ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Weekly conference discussion of recent / seminal papers in clinical biochemistry and other related fields. I would recommend it. It is a useful overview of some of the relevant clinical presentations of biochemical disorders, laboratory techniques and experimental design.
Yes, it is a great way to read papers and talk with excellent faculty about science.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As mentioned earlier, it was useful for me as a future clinician to read about the presentation, treatment and outcomes of some common biochemical disorders. It was also useful for my future research work to learn about the experimental methods, types of studies, hypotheses and how they were tested.

It got methinking about limitations of techniques and how science was done before the now standard toolkit of molecular techniques was available. It was a lot of help in terms of developing my scientific thinking.
